block.p: Serena Gopsal Oh, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Jae Yull Oh of Flushing, Queens, was married yesterday to J. Stephen Castellano, a son of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph Castellano of Chappaqua, N.Y. The Rev. Dr. Timothy Ives, a Congregational minister, officiated at the New York Botanical Garden in the Bronx. The Rev. Young Kil Moon, a Methodist minister, took part in the ceremony.

Mrs. Castellano, 29, is the associate director of admission at Princeton University. She graduated from Wellesley College and received a master's degree in higher education administration from Stanford. Her father, who is retired, was an insurance broker in Flushing for the New York Life Insurance Company. Her mother, Dae Ja Oh, is a receptionist in a dentist's office in Flushing.

Serena Gopsal Oh, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Jae Yull Oh of Flushing, Queens, was married yesterday to J. Stephen Castellano, a son of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph Castellano of Chappaqua, N.Y. The Rev. Dr. Timothy Ives, a Congregational minister, officiated at the New York Botanical Garden in the Bronx. The Rev. Young Kil Moon, a Methodist minister, took part in the ceremony.

Mrs. Castellano, 29, is the associate director of admission at Princeton University. She graduated from Wellesley College and received a master's degree in higher education administration from Stanford. Her father, who is retired, was an insurance broker in Flushing for the New York Life Insurance Company. Her mother, Dae Ja Oh, is a receptionist in a dentist's office in Flushing.

Mr. Castellano, 28, is known as Stephen. He is a vice president in the New York securities unit of Credit Lyonnais, the French bank, for which he researches telecommunications services stocks. He graduated from Oberlin College. His father retired as a corporate lawyer for CBS Inc. in Manhattan. The bridegroom's mother, Susan Willett Castellano, is a social worker in private practice in Chappaqua.
